org.digijava.kernel.security.permission

Interface AdditivePermission


  • public interface AdditivePermission

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isRelativePermission(java.security.Permission permission)
      Verifies if permission, passed by parameter is "relative" or, in other words, can be used in "plus" and "minus" operations.
      AdditivePermission minus(java.security.Permission permission)
      Returns result of minus operation on permissions.
      AdditivePermission plus(java.security.Permission permission)
      Returns result of plus operation on permissions.

    • Method Detail

      • plus

        AdditivePermission plus(java.security.Permission permission)
        Returns result of plus operation on permissions. For example, you can add EDIT permission on some object to ADMIN permission on the same object
        Parameters:
        permission - Permission which must be added
        Returns:
        result of addition operation

      • minus

        AdditivePermission minus(java.security.Permission permission)
        Returns result of minus operation on permissions. For example, you can exclude EDIT permission on some object from ADMIN permission on the same object
        Parameters:
        permission - Permission which must be excluded
        Returns:
        result of exclude operation

      • isRelativePermission

        boolean isRelativePermission(java.security.Permission permission)
        Verifies if permission, passed by parameter is "relative" or, in other words, can be used in "plus" and "minus" operations. For example - same target classes, same object ID, etc
        Parameters:
        permission - Permission for which relativeness must be checked
        Returns:
        true, if permission is "relative". false - if not
